meanings.definition: The act or process of forming veins.
meanings.sent1: The veining of the marble added elegance to the sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The veining in the leaf helped transport nutrients efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The artist joked that the veining in the painting made it look like a map of a fictional land.
meanings.sent4: The intricate veining of the tree roots connected the entire forest like a network.
meanings.sent5: The veining in the rock formation told a story of its ancient origins.

meanings.definition: A pattern of lines or markings resembling veins, as in marble or wood.
meanings.sent1: The veining on the countertop gave it a luxurious appearance.
meanings.sent2: The veining in the wood grain created a beautiful natural design.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorator skillfully replicated the veining of marble on the fondant.
meanings.sent4: The veining in the fabric made it look like a piece of art.
meanings.sent5: The veining in the leaves of the plant mimicked delicate brush strokes.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of veins in a leaf or other structure.
meanings.sent1: The veining of the leaf helped in photosynthesis.
meanings.sent2: The veining in the wings of the butterfly was intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully arranged the veining of the salad leaves to resemble a heart shape.
meanings.sent4: The veining in the petals of the flower guided insects towards the nectar.
meanings.sent5: The veining in the fabric of the dress added a touch of nature to the design.
